column1: Question for you. Following up on, you're using VR and then kind of watching through some scenarios. What did you think about the use of VR in the home stories and at the school story?
I think it was very helpful, except for the first one.
Why didn't you like the first one?
like, when they're on the VR headset every single day, and they can't, they can't do all the stuff together, it's going to create problems
Yeah, that definitely makes sense. What kind of, or are there like specific benefits that you see? How do you describe the problem? What are some benefits that you saw?

From what I see, you get to do stuff without actually having to go anywhere... many physical activities you don't have to be like super active you can actually just sit on the floor ... without having to like get tired
Yeah, for sure, what kind of problems that VR creates for you as a kid, especially since you've used VR before?
Sometimes I get headaches a lot, because the screen is too close to your face
for sure, who do you think should decide which VR experiences are a good choice for children?
no idea? Do you think it's parents, or it's teachers?
I don't want... whatever I want t o do
Okay, that's fair. When VR makers are creating these VR experiences for children and families, what are some of the things that you think they should keep in mind?
Just keep it family oriented, open for everybody
What do you mean by family friendly?
Yeah! Is there anything else that you want to share about your experience in VR? Any thoughts you have on VR
In my experience? Sometimes there's bad games, sometimes there's good games, you just gotta find the ones that you really like
Yeah! Yeah, absolutely. Well, thank you so much for your time. It's been a great help. Feel free to either grab a backpack or some stuffed animal perfect
